page.title: 11ANCIENT ESTATE, ARNPRIOR
page.content: The Garden estate employs two foresters to look after 10 acres of mixed woodland, 73 acres of coniferous trees, 42 acres of deciduous trees, 23 acres of scrubland and 63 acres of natural woodland. The types of coniferous trees include sitka spruce, Norway spruce, Corsican pine, Contorta pine, Scotch pine, European larch, Japanese larch and Douglas fir. Deciduous trees include oak, ash, elm, beech, chestnut, lime, poplar and sycamore. Coniferous trees are felled after 60-70 years, but deciduous trees grow for 100-150 years. Planting is done in Spring and this year 3500 young oaks were planted in small plantations and along the hedgerows. Felling takes place in autumn or winter.
